tit.cmt: 次に説明があるし、麹座が引き起こしたRiotではないので括弧書きを削除しました。ご確認願います。I've added "era" as otherwise the reader would have no idea what "Bunan" is supposed to mean. I've also added an explanation of "koji" in the first sentence of the text below as this is a term that the reader is unlikely to recognize.

sen.j: 文安の麹騒動（ぶんあんのこうじそうどう）とは、室町時代、京都において酒造工程の一つである麹造りを支配していた座（北野麹座）が室町幕府の攻撃を受けて没落した事件。
sen.e: Bunan no Koji Sodo was an incident in which Kitano koji za (A koji malt guild in Kitano) that controlled production of koji malt in Kyoto, a process of sake brewing, was attacked by Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and declined in Muromachi Period.

Bunan no Koji Sodo was an incident in which Kitano koji za (A koji malt guild in Kitano) that controlled production of koji malt in Kyoto, a process of sake brewing, was attacked by Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) causing its decline during the Muromachi Period.

Bunan no Koji Sodo was an incident in which Kitano koji za (a guild in Kitano for producers of koji malt, a kind of mold grown on produce such as boiled rice), who controlled production of koji malt (which is part of the sake brewing process) in Kyoto, was attacked by the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) causing its decline during the Muromachi Period.

sen.j: この結果、麹の専門業界は没落して酒屋業へ組み入れられた。
sen.e: As a result of this, the industry specialized in the koji malt was brought to ruin and incorporated into sakaya (liquor store) industry.
As a result, this lead to the downfall of the koji malt industry which was subsequently incorporated into the sakaya (liquor store) industry.

sen.e: Obtaining the position of jinin (associates of Shinto shrines) at Kitano-sha Shrine (present Kitano Tenmangu Shrine), the kojiya formed a guild called "koji-za" and had an exclusive rights to produce and sell the koji malt in the western part of Kyoto supported by the authority of Kitano-sha Shrine (honjo (proprietor or guarantor of manor)).
